text.tspan: polarization analyzer: module to analyze the polarization of the CL light
l1: lens 1 position can be adjusted perpendicular to the optical axis;
b: light for spectrograph to calibrate the position offset between the two
detectors the grating offset and the m1 position
l: additional non-moveable lens; functions as passive focusing optic
l: additional non-moveable lens; functions as passive focusing optic
s: slit not needed for ARPOL and therefore opened (position: "on")
fw: rotatable emission filterwheel to select a specific wavelength band
m: passive mirror collimates the light and redirects it towards grating turret
gt: switched to position 2 (mirror); redirects light to the detectors
m1: mirror to focus the light within the spectrograph on the detectors
m2: mirror to switch between two detectors (position 1 and 2)
ebeam: electron beam of the scanning electron
mirror: parabolic mirror to collect the cathodoluminescence
(CL) light emitted by the sample; mirror is engaged into the
beam path using its short and long axes and the fine
adjustments are done via the x-y-referential
role: mirror (axes: s (short axis) and l (long axis))
sample stage (optional): microscope stage to position
role: stage (axes: x, y, z, rz)
scan stage (optional): second stage for fine adjustment
ow: optical window, which is transparent for the CL light
*optical path properties: contains parameters concerning the
parabolic mirror and the lens system
*power control unit: power supply for the components:
det 1 and det 2 (depending on hardware), pol1, pol2, l1, l2, s1, spectrograph
spectrograph: combines the slit (s) and the grating turret (gt)
to select the mirror or a combination of grating and center wavelength

tspan.tspan: role: spectrograph (axes: wavelength, optional: slit-in, grating)

text.tspan: In ARPOL no axis "slit-in" as slit is switched to "on" (slit-in-big)
In ARPOL mirror is selected via axis "grating" and axis "wavelength" is therefore 0
spectrometer 1: combines the component spectrograph and detector 1
spectrometer 2: combines the component spectrograph and detector 2
